column4: this is the only xorg.conf I can get to load, can someone please help me to get unity back up and running; http://paste.ubuntu.com/658343/
what's the issue
no unity :(
do you have X?  A gui?  Gnome 2?
i have tried playing with the file, removing any of the screens or cards results in it not loading saying "screen not found"
way, way different issue...
I have installed the drivers and tried it (from teh bios) in discrete and switchable
are you on it now?
I have the latest kernel 2.6.38-11-generic-pae
I am, with the old gnome
ok...did you try logging out, then switching the desktop session to "ubuntu"
it is booted into 'ubuntu' I have tried a reboot as well
what version of ubuntu are you running?
my frustration is that in switchable mode, lspci -v shows that the intel is on 0:1:0:0 and the nvidia is on 0:2:0:0 but I cannot get it to boot to that card
what graphics card do you have?
specifically
nvidia GT330M
have you installed the restricted drivers?
yes
using what?
System--> Admin--> additional drivers
